examples: France's social security also legally requires price transparency.
Legally acquired, though.
The companies have all of this information about you, and legally.
Crabbers can legally break off both claws if they meet the required size.
Congrats, you're legally an adult.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is required or allowed by the law
words.defineVi: theo cách được pháp luật yêu cầu hoặc cho phép

examples: Underneath the orange tree, the leaves gently fall.
I rolled up the rug to clean the floor underneath it.
I plan to cut the ground from underneath the prosecutor's feet with this line of questioning.
The real quills are underneath.
Their head is actually underneath, right here
words.defineEn: directly below something, particularly when concealed by the thing on top
words.defineVi: ngay bên dưới một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là khi bị che khuất bởi thứ trên cùng

examples: Before the recession, the country was on the pig's back, but the situation has changed greatly.
Geography can actually greatly affect the taste of coffee beans.
Together, these measures greatly slowed down population growth.
Soil acidity also greatly affects bone preservation.
During the 20th century, mass distribution greatly increased the popularity of milk chocolate.
words.defineEn: to a great amount or degree; very much
words.defineVi: đến một số lượng lớn hoặc mức độ; rất nhiều

examples: The compass needle always points north.
They went farther north into the mountains.
The north side of the building gets the most sunlight in the morning.
Many migratory birds fly south for the winter and return north in the spring.
The compass needle points to the north when you're facing south.
words.defineEn: toward or to the north
words.defineVi: hướng về phía bắc

examples: Lastly, ignore attacks.
Lastly, select your Chromecast device.
And lastly, I despise cold weather.
Lastly, you'll need a rosette piping tip.
Lastly, we have seen this emergence of a new variant of the coronavirus.
words.defineEn: used for introducing a final point, item, etc. after mentioning all the others
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để giới thiệu một điểm cuối cùng, mục, vv sau khi đề cập đến tất cả những người khác

examples: In his mother’s eyes, the boy can do no wrong.
The journalist published a wrong statement in the article.
I accidentally hit the wrong key.
Unfortunately, the president struck the wrong note in his speech, ignoring the public mood.
She pressed the wrong button and accidentally deleted the file.
words.defineEn: in a way that is incorrect, inappropriate, or undesirable
words.defineVi: theo cách không chính xác, không phù hợp hoặc không mong muốn

examples: That man eats Ramen noodles daily for dinner but for his dog, he threw a big party.
The plants want watering daily.
The mother of two young children felt overwhelmed by her daily tasks, which included cooking, cleaning, and child-rearing.
And you still can't get a good daily woman now to clean, not for love or money.
Support your thyroid health by incorporating bladderwrack supplements into your daily routine.
words.defineEn: in a way that happens every day or once a day
words.defineVi: trong một cách mà xảy ra mỗi ngày hoặc một lần một ngày

examples: For the first offence I was given a fine.
There's a fine line between humour and inappropriateness.
Our fine traditions give us a head start on the competition.
Farah ran a fine race to take the gold medal.
If he wants to play a game of cat and mouse, fine, I'll play.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is acceptable or satisfactory
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là chấp nhận được hoặc thỏa đáng

examples: My dad doesn't play golf any more.
Any investment involves an element of risk.
A self-made vase will give any interior a touch of originality.
No conventional drugs had produced any significant change.
No one paid them any attention.
words.defineEn: to any extent; in the least
words.defineVi: ở mức độ nào; ít nhất

examples: This has their web FAI information on it presumably.
Presumably this would go somewhere else.
Presumably, it's costing your neighbor a fortune as well. -
So presumably, bigger Dimetrodons would need bigger sails.
And then presumably, there's also,
words.defineEn: used to say that the thing mentioned is based on an assumption
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng điều được đề cập là dựa trên một giả định

examples: Guy sneezed loudly.
We cheer loudly for our favorite soccer team during the match.
We cheer loudly for our school's volleyball team during their matches.
To laugh loudly/aloud/heartily.
Startled by the sudden noise, the baby began to cry loudly.
words.defineEn: producing a sound or noise with high volume
words.defineVi: tạo ra âm thanh hoặc tiếng ồn với âm lượng lớn

examples: John seems genuinely remorseful for what happened.
People are really celebrating, genuinely so.
They genuinely stink.
I genuinely do have hope for the sport.
People might genuinely use this.
words.defineEn: used for emphasizing honesty, sincerity, or seriousness
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh sự trung thực, chân thành hoặc nghiêm túc

examples: I try not to get too caught up in the small things, because in the grand scheme of things, it will be all the same a hundred years hence.
Hence the name of the park By this time, dinosaurs had already acquired a variety of body plans and adaptations.
Hence the common refrain: correlation doesn’t imply causation.
And hence, the vehicle fleet is also very, very different to the fleet in the U.S.
And hence, the shape of the orbit must be an ellipse.
words.defineEn: for this reason; because of this
words.defineVi: vì lý do này; vì điều này

examples: When a student goes AWOL repeatedly, the Principal determines the appropriate disciplinary action, up to and including recommendation for discharge.
They gave him his walking papers after he repeatedly missed deadlines.
Despite his friends shouting his name repeatedly, Mark remained oblivious, completely deaf as a post to their calls for attention.
The driver who repeatedly ignored traffic laws eventually got into a serious accident and suffered injuries.
After repeatedly breaking the rules, he has asked for it and finally got reprimanded.
words.defineEn: again and again; several times
words.defineVi: lặp đi lặp lại; vài lần

examples: He got the hook, reportedly due to differences with his co-star.
That year, Chuck E. Cheese's losses reportedly totaled $15 million.
The star also reportedly brings in $2 million a year from his deal with Monster Beverage.
The crime ring reportedly included actual Hermès employees.
The current free-to-play champ, Fortnite, reportedly brings in over $2 million a day.
words.defineEn: based on what some people say or what is heard
words.defineVi: dựa trên những gì một số người nói hoặc những gì được nghe

examples: Lobbying is arguably the American government's oldest profession.
They arguably comprise one of the most important retail businesses in the country.
Viruses are arguably the most notorious parasites on Earth.
Arguably, one of the most important molecules in all of biology is ATP.
Arguably the most famous robot on its way to Mars is the Mars 2020 Rover.
words.defineEn: used when giving an opinion one believes could be supported by providing reasons for it
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi đưa ra ý kiến mà một người tin rằng có thể được hỗ trợ bằng cách cung cấp lý do cho nó

examples: Politically we are on a razor edge.
Some very politically correct parents won’t let their children play with toy guns.
In recent years, comedians have found themselves in hot water for making politically incorrect topics about everything from race to gender.
Douglas held his tongue, preferring not to speak out on a politically sensitive issue.
He was an interesting speaker, if not always politically correct in his views.
words.defineEn: in a way that is related to politics
words.defineVi: theo cách có liên quan đến chính trị

examples: In it, social scientists randomly assigned low-income families into a control group or one of two experimental groups.
Mutations occur randomly in our DNA all the time.
With genetic drift, genetic differences vary randomly within a population.
They're randomly selected 30 people.
Hirsutism can sometimes happen randomly, especially in those of Middle Eastern, Mediterranean, or South Asian descent.
words.defineEn: based on chance instead of a pattern or plan
words.defineVi: dựa trên cơ hội thay vì một khuôn mẫu hoặc kế hoạch

examples: Parents often support their children financially during college.
Even though our company is struggling financially, all is not lost that is in peril - we still have a chance to turn things around with a new marketing strategy.
She’s not been having an easy time of it financially.
The company was able to secure a loan by using creative accounting methods to make it appear more financially stable than it actually was.
After a heated argument with his parents, David was cut off with a cent and had to find a way to support himself financially.
words.defineEn: in a way that is related to money or its management
words.defineVi: trong một cách có liên quan đến tiền hoặc quản lý của nó

examples: Many investors have turned their attention to opportunities abroad.
He had been abroad many times.
We plan to study abroad next year to experience different cultures.
I spent a year travelling abroad, and I lived on the smell of an oily rag to get by.
He enjoyed trying new foods while traveling abroad.
words.defineEn: in or to a foreign country
words.defineVi: Vào hoặc tới nước ngoài

examples: The farmer spread the pumpkin seeds evenly in the field, anticipating a bountiful harvest in the coming months.
The risk is spread out more evenly.
Odors don’t spread out evenly.
The value of the contract is typically divided evenly through the contracts length.
But not all plant/ant relationships are so evenly balanced.
words.defineEn: in equal amounts or quantities
words.defineVi: với số lượng hoặc số lượng bằng nhau

examples: The handwriting on the wall bodes poorly for many aquatic species, but there is hope that we can make some changes to save some of them.
If she does poorly on this exam, she may lose the title of valedictorian to one of the students on her heels.
I don’t want you to think poorly of your father.
The author was able to make a comeback after a series of poorly received books, with a new novel that became a bestseller and earned critical praise.
With the company doing so poorly these days, we're all afraid that layoffs are in the wind.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is unsatisfactory or improper
words.defineVi: theo cách không thỏa đáng hoặc không đúng cách

examples: Ideally we want to ten or fifteen minutes.
Ideally, you're the same person.
Ideally avoid thinking about your unpaid bills, your relationship issues, the past, the future.
Of course, not all gases behave ideally, and all gases deviate from the law at low temperatures or high pressures.
Uh, I see myself ideally in LA.
words.defineEn: used to express what is preferred
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện những gì được ưa thích

examples: My lipreading skills are practically nonexistent.
The benefits of encryption as a tool are practically countless.
The shapes are practically infinite.
On an interstellar scale, humanity is practically invisible.
Scents, on the other hand, are practically limitless.
words.defineEn: to an almost complete degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ gần như hoàn chỉnh

examples: The musician's fingers lightly touched the piano keys, creating a beautiful melody.
These threats are not to be taken lightly.
The maid gave the room the once-over lightly.
My uncle's parting words to me were that life is not separate from death, it only looks that way, and that I should live fully yet let go lightly when the time came to say goodbye.
Under their fur, their skin is lightly pigmented.
words.defineEn: in a manner that involves little force or effort
words.defineVi: theo cách liên quan đến ít lực lượng hoặc nỗ lực
